Maros Művészegyüttes ensemble perform in the village of Sárpatak
Maros Művészegyüttes ensemble perform in the village of Sárpatak
This material can only be used for research and private study purposes
Folk ensemble 'Maros Művészegyüttes' [Maros Art Association] from Marosvásárhely [Târgu Mureş], performing in Sárpatak on 09/03/96. Communal dance.

Spelling of folk ensemble's name by recordist as follows: 'Maros Műres Egyűttes ensemble'. Believe recordist refers to Hungarian-Romanian folk dance ensemble Maros Művészegyüttes [Maros Art Association].
Sárpatak is also known by its Romanian name: Şapartoc

Dance evening and interview in Szentirány
Dance evening and interview in Szentirány

This material is made available under a non-commercial streaming only licence. We have been unable to locate all owners of the copyright in this material. Please contact copyright@bl.uk with any information you have regarding this item.
Folk dance music with unidentified ensembles, including an interview with the viola player from the folk dance group Maros Művészegyüttes.
The recordist also captured some pre-recorded music being played from the public address system [about 29 min. into the recording].
The first fifteen minutes of the recording are affected by failing batteries during recording (increasingly higher pitch and faster speed).
Some breaks and some silences in the recording.

Folk dance music with unidentified ensembles. Because a musician from the folk dance group Maros Művészegyüttes was interviewed on the same tape, it is likely that Maros Művészegyüttes were playing at this event.
The recordist also captured some pre-recorded music being played from the public address system [about 29 min. into the recording].
The first fifteen minutes of the recording are affected by failing batteries during recording (increasingly higher pitch and faster speed).
Break in the recording, with over two minutes of silence, about 26 min. 30 sec. into the recording.

Interview with Bör Gyuszi, viola player in the Maros Művészegyüttes ensemble
Interview with Bör Gyuszi, viola player in the Maros Művészegyüttes ensemble
This material can only be used for research and private study purposes
Bör Gyuszi is interviewed about the changes undergone by Hungarian folk music in Romania between the 1960s and the 1990s.

Spelling of folk ensemble's name by recordist as follows: 'Maros Műres Egyűttes ensemble'. Believe recordist refers to Hungarian-Romanian folk dance ensemble Maros Művészegyüttes [Maros Art Association].
Short break in the recording where the recordist changed cassette side.
